TopicTitle: [AAR] The Grand Tour - Voyage To The Planets

Articles.Content: Hope you are okay, take as a long as a break as you need.

Best luck Czo. I know from my father's stories how was the situation during the 80s with the Lybians raining Scuds on Lampedusa, and I remember the Yugoslavian wars, and the NATO intevention in Lybia.

Keep safe, you and your family.

Thank you. I hope the tension will finally cease to rise sometime this week.

By the looks of things and the enormous ammount of support messages, if things really go bad and they get to you house Czo, just call for aid on the forum and you will get a personal army coming right out of the Kerbal Forum .

EVACUATION PRIORITIES:

1-CZO and his familly;

2-CZO computer and AAR scripts (TOP PRIORITY)

3-Vodka recipes;

And that's it. Evacuate evabody, Before putin comes ridin on his bear.

Fun!

But seriously, stay safe, best of luck.

I really wish I could do more than just wish all of you out there best of luck and hope for the best... Because if Russia goes to war, we will probably all be in big trouble, considering that Germany is not that far away from Russia either...

I really wish I could do more than just wish all of you out there best of luck and hope for the best... Because if Russia goes to war, we will probably all be in big trouble, considering that Germany is not that far away from Russia either...

And we all know what happened to Germany during the Soviet era
Of course, it's a bit of a stretch to say that Russia will try to take back all of its former territory and puppet nations just based on what they're doing in Crimea.

I don't really think we will see a fully fledged war between these powers, there are too many deterrents, aside de usual nuclear deterrence (no country nukes another, fearing retaliation), but economic deterrence. Any country going to war, be it US, Russia, or any European, would have its economy ruined by investor panic, trade connections shutting off, loans freezing, resource trading screeching to a halt and basically screwing up any involved country.

dude

tucker down

hide under your covers

breath as little as you can

and

keep calm

and AAR on

http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-26413953

latest news on ukraine/ czok
czo is normally is online... hes offline

czo is normally is online... hes offline

oh heck no, dont even.....

All teams, code Red, I repeat, code Red! Communications with Czo down, Not a chance he is a regular person and that logs off once in a while, send in the brigades, fallschirmjÃƒÂ¤ger, Marines, Spec OPs, EVATHING! AND MOST OFF ALL, THE OLD LADY FROM THE CORNER SHOP THAT MAKES THOSE SWEET SWEET DONUTS.
**** SOMEONE GET EnterElysium AND SQEEGYMACKOY!!! WE MUST LAUNCH A PREEMPTIVE STRIKE!!!
And don't forget to bring our "special" armament engineer, Danny2642, he'll figure a way to take out all of Russia using a metal bar, a sepatron and a snack. He is truly the Mcgyver of Kerbal!
His profile states his last activity time was 00:27 on the forum clock, don't freak out.
I, Sylandro proudly presents, KSP: The Grand Voyage - Counting to 61
I patiently await the well-known satisfaction of seeing a page load with a really tiny scroll bar.

I patiently await the well-known satisfaction of seeing a page load with a really tiny scroll bar.

So Im not the only one

So Im not the only one

Nope, surely not.

I patiently await the well-known satisfaction of seeing a page load with a really tiny scroll bar.

Yeah, I know right?

Because, as it turns out, the threat of Russian military intervention is smaller with every passing day and the situation is slowly stabilizing (it's still bad but at least stable!), after spending the last several days reading news concerning Ukraine I would love to put it all aside for a time being and concentrate on something else for a change.

T minus 48 hours

Thank you all for support and kind words although I think Ukrainians needs them more right now than Poles, with Poland being NATO member and all - but we are always getting nervous when stuff like this happens near our borders and hey, after WW2 one shouldn't expect anything else.
Awesome to hear that things have cooled down over there, we're glad nothing serious happened. Anyaways, i'm sure everyone's giddy to see the return of the Grand Tour. Write on!
Good to hear things are cooling down, and timer has been set
Glad you can rest a bit easier, Czok. Looking forward to the next chapter.
